error.signature: error: subprocess-exited-with-error: pip subprocess to build wheel failed

verdict.summary: pip failed to build a wheel for a package with C/C++ extensions â€” missing compiler or header files.

dead_ends.why_fails: Actually makes the problem worse by requiring compilation for all packages

dead_ends.action: Installing an older version of the package
dead_ends.why_fails: Older versions may have the same build requirements

workarounds.action: Install system build dependencies: sudo apt install python3-dev build-essential libffi-dev
workarounds.how: Most C extensions need gcc and Python headers

workarounds.action: Check if a pre-built wheel exists: pip install <package> --only-binary :all:
workarounds.how: Avoids compilation entirely by using pre-built wheels

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'error' is a build error while 'Failed building wheel for X' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
